quotes.quote: Monogamy is a possibility and a necessity. Kids have got to have something they can rely on. You have got to have something you rely on.
Promiscuity is like never reading past the first page. Monogamy is like reading the same book over and over.
The concept of monogamy is an inheritance of a medieval time, when family would carry the tradition of the name and certain privileges. It's a way of organizing society, perhaps.
Marriage requires a special talent like acting. Monogamy requires genius.
We just can't shake monogamy. It definitely demands a kind of rigor and discipline and selflessness. But it's also fun.
Long term heterosexual monogamy is still the dominant model: men and women still want to pair for a long period of time.
Monogamy is faith in the faithless.
Human nature is such that monogamy is a really hard thing to achieve.
Hard work is damn near as overrated as monogamy.
Monogamy is not a choice, it is a responsibility of a genuine human.

Monogamy is desirable for many reasons especially in creating a stable emotionally connected home for children. But judging from centuries of human behavior it is also a very difficult standard to meet.
Strong relationships are not rocked by a truth that is grounded by resolute monogamy.
Monogamy is like good crystal beautiful but once you get it, all it takes is one chip and it's never the same again.
Bigamy is having one wife too many. Monogamy is the same.
In our monogamous part of the world, to marry means to halve one's rights and double one's duties.
Marriage requires a special talent, like acting. Monogamy requires genius.
Culture preaches monogamy while nature repeats it over and over again.
Monogamy is a way of getting the versions of ourselves down to the minimum.

Some women's love of being loved is insatiable; and so, often, is their love of loving; and in the last case they may find that they can't give it continuously to the chamber-officer appointed by the bishop's license to receive it.
Every one belongs to every one else.
Monogamous romantic commitment, like infallible lifelong attraction to only men or only women, is surely a minority tendency expediently elevated to a general social principle.
Monogamy is like croquet: you get the hang of it, eventually, but it's never fun to play.
Monogamy is the true path to happiness.
Monogamy is god's way of making death seem like a more reasonable option.
Monogamy is ideal as a standard, but if you look around you, it's not the end result.
If you're looking for monogamy, you'd better marry a swan.
A monogamous marriage and family is what some women want but not all of us. We are mostly doing serial monogamy anyway.
Almost everywhere people marry, monogamy is the official norm and infidelity the clandestine one.
Monogamy is contrary to nature but necessary for the greater social good.
